# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/rich/styled.py
@source-hash: 799367cc6ac8e248
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:01:46Z

## Purpose
Provides a wrapper class to apply styles to renderable objects in the Rich terminal formatting library.

## Core Components

### Styled Class (L11-34)
A wrapper that applies a consistent style across an entire renderable object. Key responsibilities:
- Stores a renderable and its associated style (L19-21)
- Integrates with Rich's rendering protocol via `__rich_console__()` (L23-29)
- Supports measurement via `__rich_measure__()` (L31-34)

#### Key Methods:
- `__init__(renderable, style)` (L19-21): Constructor storing renderable and style
- `__rich_console__(console, options)` (L23-29): Renders the wrapped object with applied style using `Segment.apply_style()`
- `__rich_measure__(console, options)` (L31-34): Delegates measurement to the wrapped renderable

## Dependencies
- `Measurement` from `.measure` - for size calculations
- `Segment` from `.segment` - for style application 
- `StyleType` from `.style` - type annotation for styles
- Console-related types imported conditionally for type checking (L7-8)

## Architecture Pattern
Follows the decorator pattern, wrapping renderables to add styling behavior. Implements Rich's rendering protocol (`__rich_console__`, `__rich_measure__`) to seamlessly integrate with the Rich ecosystem.

## Example Usage
Demo code (L37-42) shows wrapping a Panel with "on blue" background style.
